p: The crude methanol extract of the leaves of Cajanus cajan, a member of the family Fabaceae used for its antimalarial properties, nevertheless had an IC 50 value of just 53.5 μg/mL against the multidrug-resistant P. falciparum K1 strain in vitro; however, its ethyl acetate fraction yielded cajachalcone, 2′,6′-dihydroxy-4-methoxy chalcone (55) with IC 50 of 2.0 μg/mL (7.4 μM) (Ajaiyeoba et al., 2013). The relatively simple structures of these flavonoids and chalcones, which lack chiral centers, should enable a systematic exploration of their structure-activity relationships (for the structures of compounds 50– 55, see Figure 6).
